availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel G. Stuart (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Maria L. Halley Stuart in Clark County, Kentucky, on December 18, 1846. Father of Thomas G. Stuart, Jefferson Stuart, Nackie M. Stuart, John G. Stuart, and Susan Stuart. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860. Sheriff in Clark County in 1861.
